title: 626A.04 PROHIBITION OF USE AS EVIDENCE OF INTERCEPTED WIRE, ORAL, OR ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATIONS.
text: Whenever any wire, oral, or electronic communication has been intercepted, no part of the contents of such communication and no evidence derived therefrom may be received in evidence in any trial, hearing, or other proceeding in or before any court or grand jury if the disclosure of that information would be in violation of this chapter.
